messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Albany school
messages.msgSnippet: I believe (could be wrong) that this is where Piers Anthony, a well-known fantasy/sci-fi writer, went. Beth ... From: Kolleen To: Unschooling.com Sent:
messages.messageBody:
I believe (could be wrong) that this is where Piers Anthony, a well-known fantasy/sci-fi writer, went.
Beth
----- Original Message -----
From: Kolleen
To: Unschooling.com
Sent: Thursday, March 21, 2002 8:47 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Unschooling or not?


>I consider that while they are IN school, there is no way they can be
>unschoolers. They can leave and go BACK to unschooling, but even if they are
>there for band or football, they still have rules, requirements and
>expectations that are the antithesis of unschooling. Zachary went back to
>school for whatever reasons. He is not CURRENTLY unschooling, but he could
>if he left school.
>~Elissa Cleaveland


About three hours drive from here is the Albany Free School. Its a
wonderful place where kids of all ages mix together. There is no
cirriculum. There are no classes unless a kid wants to learn something
specific.

There are rules. One can't hit another kid without it going to a meeting
on the consequences. One is not allowed to destroy another's creation,
etc.

They are in all rights of New York State, a school.

The children there are prolly unschooled more than a good portions of
children who stay at home to do the exact same thing.

Its whose AGENDA is being followed that determines the name of the game.

kolleen
